posemuckel.common
Class RetriedAssert

java.lang.Object
  posemuckel.common.RetriedAssert

public abstract class RetriedAssert
extends java.lang.Object

This class allows you to assert a condition that may not be true right at the moment, but should become true within a specified time frame. To use it, simply replace calls like: 

     assert(someCondition);
With: 
     new RetriedAssert(5000, 250) { // timeout, interval
         public void run() throws Exception {
             assert(someCondition);
         }
     }.start();
The start() and run() methods were named after those in java.lang.Thread, whose function they mimic.

This class was written by Model N, Inc. You may use it and modify it any way you wish--but please leave this message intact.

_intervalMs

private int _intervalMs
Constructor Detail

RetriedAssert

protected RetriedAssert(int timeOutMs,
                        int intervalMs)
Constructor.

Parameters:
timeOutMs - The minimum total length of time, in milliseconds, to try the assert before giving up and registering the assertion failure "for real". This is not treated as a precise upper limit.
intervalMs - The length of time, in milliseconds, to sleep between tries.
Method Detail

start

public final void start()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Starts the retries. If your implementation of run() has an assertion failure, it sleeps and tries again, until the timeout has elapsed, at which time it lets the assertion failure propagate. However, if run() throws another type of Exception, this will be propagated out to the caller immediately.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

run

public abstract void run()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Users of this class implement this method to perform the asserts they want.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
